snippet: The move comes after analysis of a 2011 study that found that a black scientist was less likely than a white one to receive institute financing for biomedical research.
abstract: National Institutes of Health announces initiatives aimed at helping blacks and other ethnic and racial groups who have been unrepresented among medical researchers; move comes after 2011 study showing that black scientists were less likely than white ones to receive institute financing for biomedical research.
lead_paragraph: The move comes after analysis of a 2011 study that found that a black scientist was less likely than a white one to receive institute financing for biomedical research.

headline.seo: N.I.H. to Start Initiatives to Raise Number of Minority Scientists
headline.main: Federal Initiative Aims to Raise Number of Minority Scientists
headline.print_headline: Federal Initiative Aims to Raise the Number of Minority Scientists
